title: Beyonce 'could not stop crying' at the unveiling of Tyler Perry's massive new film studio in Atlanta
text:
She's a legend in her own right.

And Beyonce was completely consumed with joy at the star-studded unveiling of Tyler Perry Studios in Atlanta, Georgia, on Saturday evening.

The 38-year-old powerhouse shared that she 'could not stop crying' at the awe-inspiring studio as she stepped out wearing a custom-made Yousef Al Jasmi yellow beaded gown with husband Jay-Z.

Powerful: Beyonce was completely consumed with joy at the star-studded unveiling of Tyler Perry Studios in Atlanta, Georgia, on Saturday evening

'Happy Sunday. Congratulations to Tyler Perry on the opening of his studios. I could feel our ancestors’ presence,' she wrote on Instagram.

Tyler's new venture is one of the largest in the United States at 330-acres, with Perry making history as the first Black person to own a studio outright and without corporate backing.

'Surrounded by my heroes, I watched Denzel, Queen Oprah, Spike, Whoopi, Sir Poitier, Will, Halle, Dame Cicely and our angels John Singleton and Diahann Carroll honored,' she added.

Congratulations! Tyler's new venture is one of the largest in the United States at 330-acres, with Perry making history as the first Black person to own a studio outright and without corporate backing

Beaming: The 38-year-old powerhouse shared that she 'could not stop crying' at the awe-inspiring studio as she stepped out wearing a custom-made Yousef Al Jasmi yellow beaded gown with husband Jay-Z

The land on the former For McPherson complex was previously used as a Confederate army base during the American Civil War and has 12 sound stages, each named after a prominent Black actor.

'The Armand de Brignac crashed against each soundstage as fireworks lit up the sky. Generations of blood, sweat and tears, success, excellence and brilliance,' she wrote. 'It makes me so proud, so full, I could not stop crying.

'Thank you my Virgo brother for so much love and passion put into every detail. My prayer today is that you will take it all in. You inspire me to dream even bigger.'

Tyler told Essence magazine that he built the studios to encourage young people to stay inspired and continue building their dreams.

'More than anything, what I'm hoping it becomes is for everybody else who is ever dreaming and hoping—they can do it too,' he said. 'So that's what I want it to become, fully.'

Perry has created an incredible legacy as an actor, comedian, producer, writer and director, and has been listed as one of the highest paid men in the industry by Forbes.

His 2005 film Diary of a Mad Black Woman introduced his most popular character to date, Madea, who he created with inspiration from his late mother and aunt.
